intro: Heracleum sphondylium subsp. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean cow parsnip, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils. The plant features a tall, hollow stem with large, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in an umbrella-like inflorescence. It is native to the Pyrenees region and is often found in meadows and forest margins.
